flawed_nl_solution:
Store A has a $125 x 2/25 = $<<125*2/25=10>>10 discount.
So the smartphone from store A will only cost $125 - $10 = $<<125-10=115>>115.
Store B has a $130 x 1/10 = $<<130*1/10=31>>31 discount.
So the smartphone from store B will only cost $130 - $31 = $<<130-31=99>>99.
Thus, store A's smartphone is $99 - $115 = $<<99-115=-16>>-16 cheaper than that of store B.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 13, not 31. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
